data.title: Great little place
data.text: this is a tortilleria which also sells nachos, burritos, tamales, tamale boats (tamale smothered in chile Colorado or chile verde) masa for tamales and a few other items. Small family run business that has been around since the 60's and still just as good

data.title: THE Go-To place in Indio!
data.text:
If you live in Indio, then you know how awesome this spot is. If you are visiting, or traveling through, then you HAVE to stop. If you look the wrong way, you will drive right by it. It is a tiny little spot. When you walk in, the fragrance is amazing, and you know you are at a dynamite place.  Grab a tamale boat, or just a small bag of chips with their famous salsa……..Forget about it! Any of their food is delicious, but they are most famous for their chips and salsa. Almost every birthday, wedding, bbq, quincanera, and family event in town has to get Arriola's chips.
Nothing fancy, just good, traditional, Mexican food from a family business that has been around for generations. If you are looking to make tamales from scratch, then they have the masa already prepared and ready to go. Their home made tortillas are so good too!

data.title: Excellent Mexican takeout.
data.text: Small store front on a side street. Food is worth the search. The chips, salsa and cheese sauces are excellent. You can buy in large quantities for large parties Other items are available, but these are the only ones I have tried--many times over the years!

data.title: Chips!
data.text: I haven't had a meal here in some time but we never have a party without buying an extra large bag of their chunky, salty, perfectly fried tortilla chips and a bucket of their excellent salsa. If you're looking for a snack, buy a paper sack of chips, dump the salsa in the bag, give it a shake and enjoy! Absolutely authentic. Try their tamales. We NEVER stand in line for the very expensive, usually awful tamales at Indio's annual tamale festival. There is only one line to stand in and that one is an hour long. We just go to Arriola's a day or two ahead and relax at home with a blender of Margarita's.  That's the way we do it!

data.title: Better than famous Tamale festival
data.text:
Great Salas and chips, can not beat the tamales.

Save money next time you come to famous Tamale festival and visit this place!

data.title: TAMALES
data.text: Arreola's has the best tamales and chips in the Valley. They are a tradition for my family. Arreola's has been there FOREVER. The modest storefront is nothing compared to the operations just behind the wall. Yet, they still make the tamales taste homemade. If you try just one, you'll be hooked.

data.title: GREAT SALSA!
data.text: Have been going to Arriola's for many years.  Love the salsa, tortillas, chips, and tamales.  Always fresh and VERY good.  Strictly "take out".  Staff is very good and selection is great!

data.title: Definitely check this place out!
data.text: Good nachos, huge burritos, and good service. Definitely check it out if you're in the area! All food is to-go (no seating), but that doesn't change how good the nachos with chili rojo are!

data.title: A little pricey but good...
data.text: Been eating their house made chips and salsa on and off for years.  The chips are flavorful but a little bit thicker than I like.  The salsa is basically a flavored-up version of tomato sauce, but it is still good.  The nachos are very popular and I know lots of people who love them, but I personally don't go for cheesey sauce from a can, so I just stick to the chips and salsa.  They're open every day of the year except for maybe Christmas and New Year's.  Counter service only, no place to eat or sit inside.
